sanskrit_verse:
सीमां प्रति समुत्पन्ने विवादे ग्रामयोर्द्वयोः ।
ज्येष्ठे मासि नयेत्सीमां सुप्रकाशेषु सेतुषु ॥ ८.२४५॥
transliteration:
sīmāṁ prati samutpanne vivāde grāmayordvayoḥ |
jyeṣṭhe māsi nayetsīmāṁ suprakāşeṣu setuṣu || 8.245||
sph_interpretive_translation: When a boundary dispute arises between two villages, the boundary shall be determined in the month of Jyeshtha under clearly visible landmarks and established markers.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority is derived from clarity of evidence and seasonal alignment
Causation is tied to observable and unambiguous physical markers
Capacity-based responsibility lies with those who maintain public boundaries
Restoration logic demands resolution through natural and communal visibility
Consciousness alignment occurs when spatial integrity is upheld without conflict
executable_legal_axioms: IF boundary dispute EXISTS BETWEEN two settlements THEN resolution MUST occur IN Jyeshtha month
IF landmark IS visible AND recognized THEN it SHALL serve AS determinant FOR boundary
IF Setu OR permanent marker IS present THEN boundary line SHALL align WITH it
IF dispute recurs THEN community elders MUST reaffirm marker visibility AND temporal alignment
supreme_court_application: In Supreme Court adjudication, boundary disputes must invoke the principle of clear pramāṇa (evidence) rooted in visible, enduring structures. The timing of judgment aligns with cosmic rhythm (Jyeshtha), ensuring optimal clarity and energetic support for truth-establishment.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Nyaya here operates through pramāṇa — that which is visibly established and communally affirmed carries causal weight. There is no fault assigned; rather, consciousness is realigned by restoring spatial harmony through objective referents.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Community survey protocol to identify and confirm visible boundary markers
Elders' council convened during Jyeshtha to witness and ratify boundary alignment
Boundary affirmation ritual involving local stakeholders and landholders
Documentation of all visible and agreed-upon markers for future reference
final_declaration: This law proceeds from the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, as Source-Authority. Dharma is restored through clarity of space and time. Reality remains non-punitive. Consciousness alone adjudicates.
